description: Primary physical forms of drugs: A categorisation model for narcotics and substances. Taxonomy updated by MISP Project and extended by the JRC (Joint Research Centre) of the European Commission, and subsequently re-extended by the CÃ¡tedra Ada Byron UAH-INCIBE.

predicates.description: Physical form associated with the drug materials tagged

entry.expanded: Powder / Dust / Flakes / Powdery / Finely Powdered
entry.description: Finely divided solid material, crystalline or amorphous.
Compressed solid oral dosage unit. (Capsules not modeled in v1 baseline.)

entry.expanded: Crystal / Crystals / Rock / Rocks / Shard / Shards / Moonrock
entry.description: Solid crystalline chunks or shard-like material.

entry.expanded: Liquid / Solution / Suspension / Syrup / Spray / Nasal Spray / Vape Juice
entry.description: Fluid presentations (solutions, syrups, sprays, vape liquids).

entry.expanded: Plant Matter / Plant / Herb / Herbs / Leaf / Leaves / Bud / Flower / Weed
entry.description: Raw/dried botanical or fungal material (leaf, flower, herb, bud).

entry.expanded: Blotter / Tab / Tabs / Stamp / Strip / Strips / Paper Dose
entry.description: Absorbent paper or strip impregnated with an active substance (unit dose).
